comments:
To build my plugin with 3.0M5 or later, I've had to make it dependent on
org.eclipse.osgi 

Now, when I attempt to run the RuntimeWorkbench with "Use features in
workspace", it won't start, and the .log file has this:
!SESSION ----------------------------------------------------------------------
!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.launcher 4 0 Feb 01, 2004 16:32:39.319
!MESSAGE Exception launching the Eclipse Platform:
!STACK
java.io.FileNotFoundException:
/home/dcorbin/eclipse/workarea/plugins/org.eclipse.osgi/eclipse.properties (No
such file or directory)
    at java.io.FileInputStream.open(Native Method)
    at java.io.FileInputStream.<init>(FileInputStream.java:103)
    at java.io.FileInputStream.<init>(FileInputStream.java:66)
    at
sun.net.www.protocol.file.FileURLConnection.connect(FileURLConnection.java:69)
    at
sun.net.www.protocol.file.FileURLConnection.getInputStream(FileURLConnection.java:156)
    at java.net.URL.openStream(URL.java:960)
    at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.load(Main.java:984)
    at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.loadProperties(Main.java:956)
    at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.addBaseJars(Main.java:385)
    at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.getDevPath(Main.java:378)
    at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.getBootPath(Main.java:445)
    at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:268)
    at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:742)
    at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:581)

If I copy an eclipse.properties file into the plugins/org.eclipse.osgi, I get:
!SESSION ----------------------------------------------------------------------
!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.launcher 4 0 Feb 01, 2004 16:37:06.762
!MESSAGE Exception launching the Eclipse Platform:
!STACK
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter
    at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(URLClassLoader.java:198)
    at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
    at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(URLClassLoader.java:186)
    at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:299)
    at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:255)
    at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:276)
    at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:742)
    at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:581)

Running in features mode, requires the importing of "all" the plugins and 
features into your workspace.  It is a very special setup.

With the ongoing rework of the Update component, this will no longer be 
necessary, as feature-mode and regular mode will merge into one.

Aside, the fact that you had to explicitly add org.eclipse.osgi to your 
dependency list for the plug-in to compile was a bug in Platform Core and that 
was fixed in the latest I-build.

Will leave the bug report open to track the fading away of the feature-based 
self-hosting method.

Glad to see the special mode is going away. 

I do have "all" the plugins/features imported (as binary with linked content). 
Would another style of import be more successful (in the short term)?

another requirement (that is going away soon as well) is that you import 
without linking.

You said the requirement to add OSGI to the plugin dependencies was bug that was
fixed.  I continue to have problems with it in M7.  Can you point me at a bug #
please?

The dependency on org.eclispe.osgi was resolved a while back.
Feature-based self-hosting will remain as-is with its special setup since it 
has to remain faithful to the layout Update/Manager expects the files to be in.
Closing.
